comments.body:
I'm using es6 modules with typescript throughout my projects to have tree shaking support in webpack. Writing tests this way would ensure that I can use this project in an es6 environment. Various type definitions have been changed lately to support this style, e.g. https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/types-2.0/object-assign/object-assign-tests.ts. 

What is the policy of the DT team behind this? Has it changed lately?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@import * as warning from "warning";

// this will pass without warning.
